body: The converter for OneVsOneClassifier has not been implemented yet. It should not be too complicated to do. In the meantime, OneVsRestClassifier has a converter.

> The converter for OneVsOneClassifier has not been implemented yet. It should not be too complicated to do. In the meantime, OneVsRestClassifier has a converter.

But in the document OneVsOneClassifier was mentioned.  Strange though. When can we expect to get it implemented?

issue.title: Move code implementating ovr_decision_function in a pseudo-operator

repository.name: sklearn-onnx
repository.description: Convert scikit-learn models and pipelines to ONNX

issue.body: Function [_ovr_decision_function](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/blob/b571d64066dd13b6f9b5eae399c6a20db39e5a83/sklearn/utils/multiclass.py#L451) is used in a couple of operators. This PR moves the code from the svm converter to an independant converter. This is the first step to address #895 as it is used in the prediction function [_ovr_decision_function in OneVsOneClassifier](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/blob/main/sklearn/multiclass.py#L815).

body: @pratikchhapolika I'm working on this converter now. Can you please share me some of your data (X_train, y_train, X_test, y_test, etc.) so I can do a fully testing?

> @pratikchhapolika I'm working on this converter now. Can you please share me some of your data (X_train, y_train, X_test, y_test, etc.) so I can do a fully testing?

sure. I will share it by end of day today.

> @pratikchhapolika I'm working on this converter now. Can you please share me some of your data (X_train, y_train, X_test, y_test, etc.) so I can do a fully testing?

@xiaowuhu 

I am using `OneVsOneClassifier` with `ColumnTransformer([('Text', TfidfVectorizer(), 'UTTERANCE')],remainder='drop') `

```
def create_pipe(clf):
    
    # Each pipeline uses the same column transformer.  
    column_trans = ColumnTransformer([('Text', TfidfVectorizer(), 'UTTERANCE')],remainder='drop') 
    
    pipeline = Pipeline([('prep',column_trans),                     
                         ('clf', clf)])
     
    return pipeline
```

```
clf = OneVsOneClassifier(LinearSVC(random_state=42, class_weight='balanced'))
pipeline = create_pipe(clf)
```
```
def fit_and_print(pipeline):
    
    pipeline.fit(X_train, y_train)
    y_pred = pipeline.predict(X_test)

    print(metrics.classification_report(y_test, y_pred, 
                                        target_names=le.classes_, 
                                        digits=3))
```

`%time fit_and_print(pipeline)`
got it. will update you when I am ready.
